tour_title: Gold Fever: San Francisco’s Gold Rush Legacy
tour_description: Walk the gritty, glamorous streets where fortunes rose, cities burned, and history was minted. This self-guided tour leads you through the chaos, triumph, and consequence of San Francisco’s Gold Rush era—from hidden coves to high society.

stops.name: Yerba Buena Cove Site
stops.address: Embarcadero at Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94105

theme.note: San Francisco’s original shoreline, and first port
The heart of the original town, and where news of gold first broke
theme.teaser: The square that launched a gold-fueled frenzy

theme.note: Converted raw gold into U.S. currency, survived the 1906 quake
theme.teaser: The Granite Lady who guarded the gold

stops.name: Barbary Coast Trail Marker
stops.search_hint: Barbary Coast Trail Marker, San Francisco

theme.note: Follows a path through the city’s wildest Gold Rush neighborhoods
theme.teaser: The city’s seedy underbelly carved in brass

stops.name: Jackson Square Historic District
stops.search_hint: Jackson Square Historic District, San Francisco
stops.address: Jackson St & Montgomery St, San Francisco, CA 94111

theme.note: One of the city’s oldest commercial districts, home to Gold Rush law offices, banks, and saloons

stops.name: Old Saint Mary’s Cathedral
stops.search_hint: Old Saint Mary's Cathedral, San Francisco

theme.note: Built with Gold Rush money and Chinese labor—burned in the 1906 fire, rebuilt as a symbol of resilience
theme.teaser: The church built by gold and scarred by fire

stops.name: Chinatown Gate & Grant Avenue
stops.address: Bush St & Grant Ave, San Francisco, CA 94108

theme.note: Home to Chinese immigrants who came during the Gold Rush and built the railroads, despite facing brutal discrimination
theme.teaser: Gold, labor, and the price of dreams

theme.note: Stands on Gold Rush-era foundations; part of the transformation from wild boomtown to law-and-order city

stops.name: Pioneer Park & Gold Rush Era Burial Site
stops.address: 1 Telegraph Hill Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94133

theme.note: Originally a burial ground for miners and immigrants lost to disease, fires, and crime. Now mostly vanished.
Birthplace of California banking empire, funded by gold and scandal
